revised_title: Observations and Measurements of the Planet Vesta
tldr: The author, John Jerome Schroeter, observes and measures the planet Vesta using a 13-feet reflector telescope. He finds that Vesta appears as a point of intense light, similar to a fixed star, and estimates its diameter to be half that of Saturn's fourth satellite. Vesta's small size and intense light suggest that it is near Earth and may share a cosmological origin with other planets in the same region.
